H0.text: Citric acid is the compound of which citrate is an ionized form.

H1.text: Carbonic acid is the compound from which citrate is an ionized form.

H2.text: Protein is the ionized form of citrate.

H3.text: Hydrochloric acid is the ionized form of citrate.

A4.text: a citrate is a derivative of citric acid; that is, the salts, esters, and the polyatomic anion found in solutions and salts of citric acid
